original: Janssen, Johan Henrik Linnemann, fd. borgmästare, Varberg, f. 2/3/72 i Hässlunda, Malmöh. 1., av Bertil J. o. Julia Linnemann. G. 02 m. Annie Ull-gren, d. 40. Barn: Bertil Linnemann f. 03, Margareta Linnemann 07. — Mog:ex. i Örebro 90, stud. i Upps. 90, jur. fil. ex, 91, jur. utr. kand. i Upps. %. Auskult. o. e. o. not. i Göta hovr. 96, tingstjg. 98-99, landskansl. i Hall. 1. 00, förste rådm. i Varberg 01, borg-mäst. o. not. publ. där 29-39, avsk. 39. Led. av styr. f. Hypoteksfören. f. Västkustens städer, sekr. h. drätsel-kamm. i Varberg 05-22, kamr. där 13-20, ordf. i bygg:ndn, pens :ndn, i tax :nd 06-315, fed. av HaU. 1. hush:säll-sk. förvaltn rutsk. 06-4’l, ordf. i ilänets egnah :nd 06-40. KVOZIkli 319, RNO 32, Halll. 1. hush:s»sk. stGM 26.
translated: Johan Henrik Linnemann Janssen, former mayor of Varberg, was born on March 2, 1872, in Hässlunda, Malmöhus County. He was the first child of Bertil J. and Julia Linnemann. He married Annie Ullgren in 1902, and they had two children: Bertil Linnemann, born in 1903, and Margareta Linnemann, born in 1907. Linnemann graduated from Örebro in 1890, Uppsala in 1890, and received a degree in law and political science in 1891. He became an intern and notary in the Göta Court of Appeal in 1896, served as a court clerk from 1898 to 1899, was appointed to the county administrative board of Halland in 1900, and became the first councilman in Varberg in 1901. He served as mayor and notary there from 1929 to 1939, when he retired. He was a member of the board of the Mortgage Association for the West Coast cities, secretary of the local administrative board in Varberg from 1905 to 1922, a member of the local chamber of commerce from 1913 to 1920, chairman of the building committee, pension committee, and the tax committee from 1906 to 1915, and was a member of the county's agricultural committee from 1906 to 1941. He received the Order of the North Star in 1919 and was made a Knight of the Order of Vasa in 1932. He also received the First Class Medal of the Halland Household Society in 1926.
